title: Rugby World Cup 2019 rankings – part five: Brian Moore's verdict on which quarter-finalists have the upper hand in the front-row
text:
Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions. The fifth installment sees Brian Moore deliver his verdict on which teams' front-row forwards are leading the charge.

This is in order of importance to the teams' success, how the players in these positions can influence games during the knockout stages of the tournament.

8. Australia

Their front row has been boosted by the introduction of heavyweight players like Allan Alaalatoa. Past weaknesses are long gone, though they can struggle against technical front rows.

7. Japan

Hooker Shota Horie is turning out to be one of Japan’s stars and despite their pack almost always being lighter...
description: Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions.
